free: #e Greetings, everyone
#c 大家好。
#e Thanks to this opportunity, I need to say that our wedding ceremony, (in) Rukai, is very important.
#c 感謝這次機會，我要說魯凱族的婚禮是很重要的。
#e It is important to obey the elders for having a family.
#c 要建立家庭，聽從老人是很重要的。
#e Rukai people would like to get married.
#c 如果魯凱族人想結婚。
#e If (male and female family) talked to each other and (they) accepted the engagement, the loving ceremony would not be easy since the engagement was made.
#c 如果(男女雙方)互談並答應，自訂下婚約時起，戀愛儀式就不簡單。
#e If (two families need a ceremony, (they) should give gifts and (they) dine together; (their) heart will be close
#c 如果(雙方)要完成儀式，(他們)就要互相送禮然後他們聚餐。他們的心要貼近。

gloss: 名物化-非實現-女生-名物化
free: #e Then, (the male family) should be asked to the female mamily.
#c 然後，(男方) 就要被請到女方家。
#e If the female family responded, (they) would discuss about the dowry in the wedding ceremony.
#c 若女方回應，就可以開始談結婚要準備的聘禮。

gloss: 互相-重疊-達成-名物化-完成

free: #e This way, if (they) mutually achieved, from the time (they) need to prepare the dowry…
#c 這樣，如果(他們)互相做到了，從(他們)要準備聘禮。
#e Dowry is the “dinghun” in Taiwanese.
#c 這tuasiasilangane就是台灣人的訂婚。
#e If the male makes the engagement, the dowry will be very important
#c 如果男方要準備聘禮，那是相當重要的。
#e While (they) preparing the dowry, elders discussed about the necessity items of the dowry mutually.
#c 當(他們)準備聘禮時，老人家互相談論必備的聘禮物品。
#e (elders) discussed this.
#c (老人)互相討論這個。
#e In the ancient time, engagement would take a very long time; they discussed and then got married.
#c 在以前，訂婚要花很長的時間;(他們)討論然後結婚。
#e Then, if (a marriage) is (arranged) in a hurry, then the spirit of (the two families) will have no connection.
#c 然後，若(婚禮)草率(決定)，(雙方)靈魂將會沒有連結。
#e After they discussed, (the two families) can make engagement, and (they) milled millet, and (they) have wedding ceremony.
#c (雙方)討論後，就能訂婚，椿小米，然後進行婚禮。
#e If (two families) (want) to engage and get married, (they) will first discuss about the dowry.
#c 若(雙方)想訂婚與結婚，(他們)首先要互相討論聘禮。
#e The dowry is different for nobles, civilians, and non-eldest sons.
#c 貴族、平民、非長子的聘禮不同。
#e So for necessity, the dowry, there are nobles’, non-eldest sons’, and civilians’.
#c 所以聘禮必需品有貴族用，非長子用，及平民用。
#e The dowry will be used for the wedding.
#c 這聘禮就是用於結婚。
#e The recent dowry is wood.
#c 現在的聘禮就是木材。

gloss: 名物化-非實現-男生-名物化
free: #e The male must at first lumber the wood.
#c 男生要先砍樹。
#e There must be food.
#c 要有吃的東西。
#e The food contains pork.
#c 吃的東西有豬肉。
#e The pork must be rump and sirloin.
#c 豬肉必須是腿肉或五花肉。
#e There must be rice cake.
#c 要有米糕。
#e There must be millet liquor.
#c 要有小米酒。
#e These are very important
#c 這些很重要。
#e The following needs the betel nut, millet liquor, and other food.
#c 還會有檳榔、小米酒等其他吃的東西。
#e These are called dowry.
#c 這些就叫聘禮。
#e The dowry must be put down first.
#c 聘禮一定要先拿下來。
#e Dowry must be new if (it) is put down.
#c 聘禮要是新的如果(它)被放下。
#e The dowry, there will must be wood.
#c 聘禮，一定會要有木頭。
#e There is also pork; they are exactly rump, sirloin, (and) neck.
#c 也要有豬肉，他們就是腿肉、五花肉、(和) 頸肉。
